abstract: California's promise to pay to clean up the Imperial Valley's Salton Sea, once called "an environmental Chernobyl," still faces a legal challenge. If the pledge is invalidated, the state's biggest water sale could also be nullified.
snippet: California's promise to pay to clean up the Imperial Valley's Salton Sea, once called "an environmental Chernobyl," still faces a legal challenge. If the pledge is invalidated, the state's biggest water sale could also be nullified.
lead_paragraph: One of the joys of reporting is the serendipitous encounter, the fascinating digression. It was farmers I hoped to talk to when I visited the Imperial Valley this summer for my recent article about farmers who leave fields fallow and earn money for sending the water saved to San Diego.

headline.main: Did California Overreach in Promising to Help the Salton Sea?
